<DOMAIN>DIGITAL-MEDIA</DOMAIN>
<RESUME_START>
DIGITAL MARKETING MANAGER
Core Qualifications
Window XP, Vista, 7.
Program languages: Lisp, HTML, SQL, Macros (VBA).
Software Products/Tools: Microsoft Word, Excel (Pivot table, Vlookup, etc.), Access, PowerPoint, Sharepoint, Salesforce, Google Analytics, IBM Coremetrics and Microstrategy, Infoview, Basecamp, Youtube and Facebook Analytics, Sitespect, SEO (working knowledge).
Others: Statistic, Behavioral Psychology.

EXPERIENCE

Digital Marketing Manager

08/2012 to 01/2016
Company Name
City ,
State
Grew the combined SEM, display, retargeting and affiliate marketing channel by 15% in membership this past year.
Hence an increase of $20 million in life time value.
Launched acquisition and brand awareness marketing campaigns with marketing partners Affiliate, Retargeting, SEM Adwords, Facebook, etc.) that were segmented by market.
Optimized campaigns across different channels by changing/adding keywords, creative, ad grouping, dna/cities, ad copies, bids, landing pages, etc. to lower CPA and increase ROI.
Collaborated with pricing and creative team and marketing partners to create/replace creative that reflect marketing strategies.
Worked with marketing partners to understand & compete with competitors' marketing strategies.
Maintained budgets and negotiated prices/bonuses with new/existing marketing partners.
Exported data from different marketing partners system.
Used advance Excel to dissect data and create dashboards to highlight marketing campaigns (CPA, CPC, CPM).
Used PowerPoint to present KPI, ROI and recommendations to internal teams, executives and marketing partners.
Managed an associate to maintain and optimize campaigns across different channels.
Created A/B and multivariate tests with Sitespect to find landing page/channel/messaging that generate the highest conversion rate.
Consequently increase conversion rate by 10%.
Analyzed web & marketing performance metrics such as CTR, Conversion Rate, purchase funnel conversion rate, LTV, etc. with IBM Coremetric and Google Analytics.
Affiliate Marketing Manager

04/2009 to 07/2012
Company Name
City ,
State
Managed and monitored daily affiliate performance.
Also optimized campaigns often by changing creative, landing pages, offers, etc.
As a result generated 10% increase in revenue.
Negotiated with affiliate networks for optimal cost: base on CPC, CPM, CPA.
Used SiteCatalyst, Omniture to generate daily and weekly reporting & analysis to internal team and external partners.
Researched and built partnerships with new affiliates with high levels of relevant traffic.
Worked with creative team to design creative that is relevant to current events and seasons.
Managed A/B and multivariate tests to find the highest converting landing pages.
Analyzed historic performance with advance Microsoft Excel (Pivot table and Vlookup) Developed new business models such as up selling, redesigning creative and pop ups.
Collaborated with technical teams to resolve reporting, creative or application issues.
Business Intelligent Analyst

07/2006 to 04/2009
Company Name
City ,
State
Worked with multiple teams to increase call by 18% and revenue by 10% in past years.
Used SQL to mine data from multiple databases and tables.
Also gathered data from Salesforce.
Built ad hoc report with Business Object - Infoview to highlight metrics: impressions, searches, clicks, CTR, revenue, etc.
Created a dashboard that collects raw data live without the delay of applying business rules Designed A/B testing to highlight the effects of product enhancements or replacements.
Analyzed the results of A/B testing with advance Excel (Pivot table, Vlookup, etc) and present KPI and forecast to team members and management in PowerPoint.
Identified enhancements in existing online products to increase search relevancy and customer experience, as result increase in click through rate (CTR) & more revenue.
Loan Processor/Analyst

07/2004 to 06/2006
Company Name
City ,
State
Validated and verified loan application information.
Compared application information to Database.
Analyzed supporting documentation on Automated Underwriting System.
Reviewed loan application package for completeness and accuracy.
Reconciled application information against system input, comparing individual data.
Calculated and analyzed debt to income ratio (i.e. employment, tax returns, etc.).
Also funds to close (i.e. verification of deposits, gift money, etc).
Coordinated rigorously with customers, boarding, processing, underwriting, closing, appraisal and escrow teams to close loans.

EDUCATION

Bachelor :
Cognitive Science Computational Modeling
May 2004
University of California
City
Cognitive Science Computational Modeling

SKILLS

ad, budgets, closing, Conversion, CPA, databases, Database, dna, documentation, funds, Google Analytics, HTML, IBM, Lisp, Macros, marketing strategies, marketing, market, messaging, Access, Microsoft Excel, Excel, money, PowerPoint, Sharepoint, Window, Microsoft Word, Microstrategy, networks, Operating systems, page, Pivot table, pricing, Psychology, reporting, selling, SQL, tables, tax returns, Underwriting, Vista, VBA
<RESUME_END>

<JD_START>
Job Title: Magazine Managing Editor

Location: Illinois, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
We’re looking for a creative yet highly organized managing editor with a passion for travel...

You’ll work closely with the Editor-in-Chief and a smart, positive, and supportive team dedicated to taking our digital magazine to the next level.

The right candidate can pull the juiciest content from a mediocre article and turn it into a compelling read. You’ll not only edit (and sometimes re-write) article submissions, but manage each stage of the magazine production process...

That means planning and assigning articles to our contributors for publication, managing the work flow so copy is steadily coming in, and helping to foster and grow our pool of contributors by communicating with them, editing back-and-forth, and coordinating payments.

You’ll work with the designer, illustrator, and photographers to take the magazine from the ideas stage to publication.

In addition, you’ll lead the charge for increased engagement with the digital magazine—considering what bonus elements (video/slide shows/writer insights, etc.) to commission to help bring the issue to life in a new way and drive traffic to it—and then to manage the integration of that content.

This is a full-time remote position requiring occasional—but fun—international office visits.

Responsibilities At a Glance

Keep the editorial calendar and issue plans—managing the flow of stories and making sure the issues offer a balanced selection of content. Manage issues from start to finish, keeping a flow of articles steady, assigning gaps in coverage, editing, and moving copy through the production process from idea to "print ready."Manage and grow the pool of freelance writers and regular contributors and correspondents.Lead the charge for magazine engagement in the all-digital climate—crafting and commissioning digital content for each issue to help drive traffic and engagement to the magazine.Supervise the assistant editor to make sure that person is providing needed copy for the issues and other projects.

Preferred Qualifications

College degree (MA)At least 5 years of professional writing and editorial experienceExtensive global travelProficient in a second languageKnowledge of Adobe InDesign and Google Suite

Required

Proven editorial chops:

You can spot holes in a story a mile away.You can find and/or write compelling ledes.You can write a great headline.You can fix both grammatical and structural issues.You can manage writers with grace and hold them to a deadline.You understand the balance between editing for clairity and keeping the writer’s voice.

You’re Dauntless And Driven

You’re a quick learner who can work independently.You don’t just spot problems, you offer solutions.You can handle dozens of tasks at the same time... all while keeping high editorial quality and a cool head.You learn proactively and seek out the people who can help you.You enjoy wearing lots of hats and are able to improvise and adapt to the circumstance.

Perks

Fully remote with the opportunity for paid travel writing

Option for full-time contract work or salaried position with benefits

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
